content.description: Figure 1 represents a nucleic acid fragment that is made up of four nucleotides linked together in a chain.
content.question: Figure 1. Nucleic acid fragment Which of the following characteristics of Figure 1 best shows that the fragment is <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and not <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The <math alttext="5 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="3 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> orientation of the nucleotide chain
The identity of each nitrogenous base
The charges on the phosphate groups
The type of bond linking the nucleotides together

content.answer: The identity of each nitrogenous base

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
